entry.title: BOTANICAL COMPOSITION & STYLE
entry.content:
Imaginative, interesting and dynamic composition can transform a botanical painting or illustration into a masterpiece. It is through composition that you introduce your own personal style into your work. This class helps to explain the elements that go towards creating a good composition and the basic principles underlying a successful illustration. The class will work entirely in graphite pencil, but the principles presented apply to all art media.


RED BUTTE GARDEN REFUND AND CANCELLATION POLICY


Materials List

  1. Graphite Pencils: 6H, 4H, 2H, HB, 2B, 2B, 4B,6B Brand of your choice. Tom Bow brand available only online

  2. Pad of Drawing Paper 11x14 Strathmore recommended available at Blick,Sugarhouse and Michaels 300 series or 400 series.

  3. Pad of tracing paper 11x14 Canson Foundation series, Red White and Black cover and can only be purchased locally at Hobby Lobby for around $8. There is always a 40% discount offered and can be accessed online at cashier.

  4. Pad of Bristol paper 11x14 Strathmore or Canson, Vellum or plate surface finish, 300 or 400 series

  5. Pentel white “Clic” eraser, refillable and available at all office supply stores

  6. A roll of “Scotch” brand “Removable” tape found in office supply stores on a blue plaid cardboard hanger hanging on a tape display

  7. A “kneaded” eraser It is gray and square shaped

  8. A hand held or battery operated pencil sharpener

  9. A roll of white “Artists’ Tape” available at Blick store in Sugarhouse

  10. A make-up or soft basring brush to sweep away eraser particles

  11. Small tortillions-rolled paper smudge sticks also available at Blick store

Materials Provided by Instructor

  • 1 foam board easel

  • A set of view finders

  • A blue sketch pencil

Instructor's Bio

Visit Natalia's Website

Contact Information: 801-581-8454
entry.summary: Imaginative, interesting and dynamic composition can transform a botanical painting or illustration into a masterpiece. It is through composition that you introduce your own personal style into your work. This class helps to explain the elements that go towards creating a good composition and the basic principles underlying a successful illustration. The class will work entirely in graphite pencil, but the principles presented apply to all art media.

entry.title: Updates from Around the Garden
entry.content:
As the snow melts and the Garden begins to bloom, life awakens at Red Butte Garden. Our collections of conifers, roses, daffodils, and more are alive with the spirit of spring. The Garden never looked so good!

As the Garden changes colors and forms, so has our website. At Red Butte we worked hard to create a refreshed and streamlined way for you to access our events and information. The new site brings a modern design, enhanced functionality, and a mobile optimized experience for visitors on the go.

With warmer weather on our doorstep, it’s time to plan for the 2017 Outdoor Concert Series. Tickets go on sale for Garden Members online on Monday, April 24th at 7PM and in-person on Tuesday, April 25th. Tickets for the General Public go on sale Monday, May 1st at 9AM both in-person and online. Renew or purchase a Garden-Plus Membership level or above by April 21st in order to participate in the April 24th member-only online presale.

For more information, CLICK HERE

Transform your garden by picking up some new plants at the annual Spring Plant Sale! The members-only day is May 12th, while the general public day is May 13th. You will be able to purchase a range of veggies, heirlooms, roses, trees, shrubs, shade, water-wise, and just plain fun plants. Come check it out!

For more information, CLICK HERE

In other news, the new Water Conservation Garden Grand Opening is May 20th. This inspiring new space will showcase the beauty and diversity of water-wise plants. Enjoy plants of all varieties, each with unique methods of conserving water.

For more information, CLICK HERE

Thank you for your dedication and passion for the Garden. We are excited to introduce you and your family to the beauty of nature.

If you would like to make a donation to the Garden:

We’ll see you soon!

Sincerely,
Red Butte Garden and Arboretum
300 Wakara Way, Salt Lake City, Utah, 84108
entry.summary: As the snow melts and the Garden begins to bloom, life awakens at Red Butte Garden. Our collections of conifers, roses, daffodils, and more are alive with the spirit of spring. The Garden never looked so good!

entry.title: BOTANICAL DRAWING 2
entry.content:
REGISTRATION REQUIRED


Class Time

MONDAYS
JUNE 5 - JULY 10
1PM - 4PM



This class is a continuation of Botanical Drawing 1. Students will refine their observational drawing skills through careful observation of plant structures. Students will learn to accurately draw botanical forms using pencil as the primary medium. Emphasis will be placed on line, form, light & shade, and simple perspective.


MATERIALS LIST

  • Graphite Pencils: 6H, 4H, 2H, HB, 2B, 4B, 6B Brand of your choice. Note: Tom Bow pencils available only online.

  • Pad of drawing paper 11x14. Strathmore is available at Utrecht/Blick in Sugarhouse and Michaels. 300 or 400 series. This paper is acid free

  • Pad of tracing paper: 11x14 Canson, Foundation Series, Red, White and black cover and can only be bought at Hobby Lobby for 8.00 but there is always a 40% discount coupon you can apply.

  • Pad of Bristol paper: 11x14 Strathmore or Canson, Vellum or Plate surface finish, 300 or 400 series.

  • Pentel “Clic” eraser found at all office supply stores

  • Kneaded eraser

  • Hand held or battery operated pencil sharpener

  • Roll of Scotch brand “Removable” tape mounted on a Blue Plaid card

  • Roll of white 1/2 inch “Artists Tape” available at Utrecht/Blick store

  • A makeup or soft basting brush to sweep away eraser particles

  • Tortillions – rolled paper smudge sticks (not needed for 1st class)

  • A good book to purchase: How to Draw Plants, by Keith West

I will have other drawing books for you to look through. If you have questions please e-mail me at ehult@cox.net

entry.title: BIRDING
entry.content:
REGISTRATION REQUIRED BY PHONE: 801-581-8454 (not online)

Spring Bird Watching Tour Dates


SATURDAY TOURS from 9-11:30AM
April 22, 29
May 6, 13, 20, 27

WEDNESDAY TOURS from 9-11:30AM
May 17, 31


Enjoy the Garden’s cool morning breezes and join us for a morning walk full of wildlife activity. Bullock’s Oriole, Western Tanager, Downy Woodpecker, and American Gold Finch are just some of the many birds we’re likely to see. Bring your binoculars and drop in for one or more of the scheduled birding walks. Tours are intended for adults. In case of inclement weather, please call: 801-585-0556 to check event status.


Birds of Red Butte Garden

RED BUTTE GARDEN BIRDING BROCHURE

Abundant water in ponds and Red Butte Creek, ample food sources, adequate cover, and protection within the 100 acre Garden attract birds not typically found in the surrounding foothills and neighborhoods.

Want To See More Birds?

Wear muted clothing. Avoid wearing stark white- it can startle away many birds. Speak softly, walk slowly, make no sudden gestures. Stop often or find a shady place to sit and watch.

American Kestrel
Red-breasted Nuthatch
Bullock's Oriole
Western Kingbird

entry.title: BULBS & BLOOMS
entry.content:
SPRING BLING! 450,000 BLOOMING BULBS

One of the great botanical gardens in the West and a marvelous Daffodil display each spring is found at Red Butte Garden during the spring months of mid-March, April, and early May.

Different bulb varieties peak at different times - so visit the Garden often this spring to see what's blooming.

Every fall, Red Butte Garden volunteers and staff plant additional bulbs throughout the Garden and this spring the Garden will boast a colorful array of over 450,000 blooming bulbs! Of those over 230,000 Daffodils. Other bulbs include Allium, Anemone, Calochortus, Camassia, Chionodoxa, Cyclamen, Erythronium, Fritillaria, Galanthus, Hyacinth, Hyacinthoides, Ipheion, Iris, Leucojum, Muscari, Scilla, Triteleia, and more. Further complimenting the blooming bulbs are blossoming trees, shrubs, and vines such as Magnolia, Flowering Pear, Crabapple, Hawthorn, Viburnum, Wisteria, Foxtail Lily, Lilac, and more!

Since 2013, Red Butte Garden has been recognized as an Official Display Garden by the American Daffodil Society. Our display includes 157 different cultivars from all 13 official divisions recognized by the Royal Horticultural Society of England. Our display also includes 14 recipients of the Wister and Panil Awards, which recognizes outstanding American hybridizers and daffodil selections.

In mid-March, thousands of miniature bulbs including Reticulated Iris, Siberian Squill, and Glory-of-the-Snow are not to be missed in the Rose Garden. The miniature bulbs are soon followed by thousands of daffodils and other blooming bulbs throughout the Garden.

Pack a picnic, bring your kids to play in the Children’s Garden, take a walk through the Garden's paved paths, hike in the Natural Area, or just relax and take in the warm spring sun.

Visit our Daffodils page for more information about the many Daffodil varieties in the Garden.

entry.title: WASATCH CAMERA CLUB PHOTOGRAPHY EXHIBIT
entry.content:
Meet the Artists Reception
Saturday, April 8 from 2-4PM

The Wasatch Camera Club presents a photography exhibit featuring the botanical-inspired work of many of their club members.

The Wasatch Camera Club provides a rich and enjoyable environment for club members to improve their photography with six activities that support the Club's educational goal. These include: workshops, field trips, lectures, exhibits, competitions, and one-on-one mentoring. Join us for a better image.

For more please visit:
http://www.wasatchcameraclub.com/drupal/

Clayhouse Photography
Dan Barnett

entry.title: TERRY SCOPES ART EXHIBIT
entry.content:
Terry Scopes is an abstract expressionist artist who works primarily in acrylic. Her use of vibrant colors and bold marks is an unusual interpretation of realism and fantasy.

Ms. Scopes studied art at the University of Utah, as well as with extraordinary painters that includes Nicholas Wilton, Lynn Whipple and Flora Bowley. She currently lives and works out of her home studio in Salt Lake City, Utah. Her work has been exhibited throughout the West and can be found in private collections in the United States, Canada, Europe, and Asia.

For more please visit: https://terryscopes.com/gallery-2-2/
entry.summary: Terry Scopes is an abstract expressionist artist who works primarily in acrylic. Her use of vibrant colors and bold marks is an unusual interpretation of realism and fantasy.

entry.title: JEANNE HANSEN
entry.content:
Meet the Artist Reception

Friday, June 9 from 4-7PM
Piano music by Ryan Hansen



Art By Design

A native of Salt Lake City, Utah, I studied art and design at the University of Utah. I received my Bachelors of Fine Art Degree in 1978. My post-graduate work was at the School of Visual Arts in New York City. This experience had a profound influence on me as art and design merged into one.



Click Here for a Biography of Jeanne Hansen
entry.summary: Meet the Artist Reception Friday, June 9 from 4-7PM Piano music by Ryan Hansen

entry.title: LINDA MARION ART EXHIBIT
entry.content:
I have been working as a visual artist for many years and focus primarily on landscapes, still life, and what I call "nature paintings," or elements in a landscape. Close-ups of trees, plants and flowers are of particular interest to me, especially as sunlight illuminates the structural details and enhances the variations in hue and color, ranging from cool to warm and radiant, and dark to light.

- Artist Statement

The colorations and variations in form are subtle, requiring extensive blending and shading. Many of the paintings in this exhibit were inspired by plants and flowers in my own backyard, the local parks where I walk my dog, the red-rock landscapes of Southern Utah, or trees in nearby alpine forests.

For more, please visit: http://www.lindamarionartworks.com/

entry.title: PAUL MARTO PHOTOGRAPHY EXHIBIT
entry.content:
Meet the Artist Reception

Saturday, July 22 from 1-4PM



Glorious Nature is a stunning, visual journey detailing the beautiful, the wondrous, and the “glorious” that surround us daily. This breathtaking collection of wildlife and nature shots by award winning photographer Paul J. Marto Jr., is designed to awaken something deep within our subconscious; that yearning we all have to connect with our surroundings in a more spiritual way.

- Artist Statement

Marto explains, “The stresses of everyday life do their best to rob us of simple pleasures like enjoying a glorious sunrise, witnessing a dramatic lightning strike or gazing upon a majestic raptor effortlessly riding the thermals. I strive to present vivid photographs that will both inspire and educate. I want my photography to serve as a constant reminder that we are not alone; that life is not all about us; that we can rejuvenate our collective souls with beauty and joy, if we only dare to take our eyes off of ourselves and truly start seeing the amazing world we live in.”

For more, please visit: https://500px.com/martophotography
entry.summary: Meet the Artist Reception Saturday, July 22 from 1-4PM
